column5: I am heading down south in 2 days. There won't be anyone wearing toques or gloves or long underwear down there . There won't be a cold north wind or grey, miserable days.    There won't be any ice on the ponds or the back bays. The only ice will be in the rum drinks.    There won't be any kindling to make or logs to split or ashes to clean. The only fire will be for the pig roast.    There definitely won't be any snow to shovel. The only need for a shovel would be to scoop up all the bull crap spewing from the other people's mouths at the bar.     There won't be this and there won't be that, but sadly there won't be any of these.
Down south?   There isn't going to be any ice fishing there.  I'll take care of your trout while your gone.  Just tell me your coordinates.  Where down south you going?
Damn! Better be careful posting pics like that, you might find yourself the subject of a FOI request! ? seriously though, gorgeous fish Chris thanks for posting
Beautys, and enjoy the warm weather, cuz yer coming back to hell that froze over. LOL
Thanks for that fix of beautiful trout. Should help hold me off till ice up. I think you should wear you toque down there while sipping your rum, just so they know your Canadian eh!
Ahhhh... enjoy both Chris. Specks followed by some sunny R&R, you're living it this month man! Solid fish.
Great post. Some great looking fish. As much as I love the sun more envious of the Hali hideout than your upcoming migration Cheers Gordy
Woah! Great looking trout right there!!! Need to wipe the drool from my face now...
Very,very nice right there!! Just in time before ice Cheers Rick
Done!!!!
Wow Chris !!! beauty specs ... ????
Thanks guys, it's a Hide'n out report but we actually slipped into the Muskokanees, Chuck put on a clinic, it's nice down here, I am in shorts and a T shirt sweating but my hearts in Haliburton
Nice fish guys ! Brad is a junkie. A match made in heaven I guess
He doesn't toot his own horn but he's way more junkie, knowledgeable and dialed in than I will ever be.

Ha!  This coming from the only guy in the province still out crushing largemouth this weekend lol.  Good times as always Chris.  Funny story, had a chance to meet Chris' mom and she casually asked what lake we were going to?  Just as I was about to respond Chris cuts me off with a made up lake name!  He explained later that his folks talk to too many neighbors up there.  If ever there was a truer sign of a trout guy, I haven't seen it.
Nice going guys.  This post got me itching for ice fishing.. ..have sled will travel.
Beauties!
Hey Chuck Chris better be careful or his Mom will be invoking the FOI Act!!!
That's hilarious.  Great job, splake of that calibre are far from common in most parts of Ontario.
absolute friggin tank specs  ridiculous man...and look at that lake, looks like a friggin painting.
Beauties!!!
